member.name: T:UI.SyntaxBox.AggregateSyntaxDriver
member.summary: Aggregates a driver collection to be used using the singular ISyntaxDriver interface.

member.name: T:UI.SyntaxBox.AhoCorasickSearch
member.summary: Canonical algorithm for quickly finding all occurances of muiltiple keywords in a longer text.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.AhoCorasickSearch.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an Aho-Corasick keyword search automation.
member.param: The list of words t osearch for.
Ensures that matches start and end on a word boundary (alphanumeric or '_'). Default = true.
If enabled, overlapping matches are allowed, e.g. elsif => elsif, if. Default = false.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.AhoCorasickSearch.InitiateTables
member.summary: Creates and initiates all automation tables

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.AhoCorasickSearch.InitiateAutomation
member.summary: Initiates the automation, loading it into the created tables.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.AhoCorasickSearch.NextState(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds the next state based on the current state and the next input character.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.AhoCorasickSearch.FindAll(System.String)
member.summary: Scans Text returning all occurances of any keyword in the dictionary.

member.name: T:UI.SyntaxBox.KeySequenceBinding
member.summary: Entry point to create a multi-key binding sequence. Simply introduces a new type converter for the Gesture property, to parse sequences on the form Modifier+Key1, Key2, ..., KeyN.
member.example: <Window.InputBindings> <syntax:KeySequenceBinding Gesture="Ctrl+A, B" Command="..." /> <syntax:KeySequenceBinding Gesture="Ctrl+A, C" Command="..." /> </Window.InputBindings>

member.name: T:UI.SyntaxBox.KeySequenceGesture
member.summary: Gesture implementation. Keeps a sequence of keys and advances the pointer in the sequence if a keystroke matches.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.KeySequenceGesture.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures that the default constructor cannot be used externally.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.KeySequenceGesture.#ctor(System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Windows.Input.Key},System.String)
member.summary: Initializing constructor.
member.param: List of keys in the sequence

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.KeySequenceGesture.Matches(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.InputEventArgs)
member.summary: Matches an input event to the current state of the instance. If a match is found, the _pointer is advanced forward in the sequence. Returns true only if the match is made on the LAST element in the sequence.

member.name: T:UI.SyntaxBox.KeySequenceConverter
member.summary: Converts a string into either a KeyGEsture or a KeySequenceGesture if multiple keys are specified.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.KeySequenceConverter.CanConvertFrom(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance can convert from the specified sourceType. Can convert from string and nothing else.
member.returns: true if this instance [can convert from] the specified context; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.KeySequenceConverter.ConvertFrom(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Converts from.
member.exception: Argument must be of string type - value

member.summary: Forces the driver logic to be re-applied to all text.

member.summary: Renders the visible parts of the syntax text and line numbers directly to the drawing context.
member.param: The drawing instructions for a specific element. This context is provided to the layout system.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.GetSyntaxDriver
member.summary: Gets the configured syntax drivers as an aggregate driver.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.GetSubstringRect(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Media.Typeface,System.Double,System.Windows.FlowDirection,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates a rectangle for highlighting a specific part of a text line.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.CalculateRequiredLineNumberWidth(System.Int32,System.Windows.Media.Typeface,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the required width of the line number canvas.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.GetScrollViewer
member.summary: Gets the scroll viewer part.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.AttachScrollViewer
member.summary: Attaches the scroll viewer ScrollChanged event. Since the ScrollViewer isn't created untill after the renderer is initialized, the scroll viewer events can't be attached by the attahced property. Instead this method has to be called sometime after the initialization process. (OnRender or when the scroll viewer is first used).

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.GetScrollBarSizes
member.summary:
Gets visible size of the scroll bars as a size. Width => vertical scroll bar Width, Height => horizontal scroll bar Height.
This will return 0 for any dimension that is currently hidden.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.GetLineHeight
member.summary: Calls the TextBox.GetLineHeight of Target via reflection.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.DecreaseBlockIndent
member.summary: Decreases the indentation of the current text selection.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.IncreaseBlockIndent
member.summary: Increases the indentation of the current text selection.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.DecreaseCaretIndent
member.summary: Decreases the indentation at the current caret position.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.IncreaseCaretIndent
member.summary: Icreases the indentation at the current caret position.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.OnTargetChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Triggered when the target textbox changes. Detaches from any old textbox and attaches events on the new instance.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.TargetTextChanged(System.Object,System.Windows.Controls.TextChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Invalidates the control on TextChanged, allowing syntax highlighting to execute.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.SyntaxRenderer.TargetPreviewKeyDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles keyboard input like tab indent expansion.

member.name: T:UI.SyntaxBox.Text
member.summary: Extension methods dealing with text.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.Text.GetLineAtPosition(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a TextLine representing the line at a specific char position in Text.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.Text.GetLines(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parses the text returning a chunk of lines as TextLines starting at First line and ending on Last line or at the end of the text. This can be done using built-in TextBox functions, but this is >5x faster.
member.param: The first line to include in the chunk.
The last line to include in the chunk.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.Text.GetLines2(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parses the text returning a chunk of lines as TextLines starting at First line and ending on Last line or at the end of the text. This is the same as GetLines, but uses the Aho-Corasick algorithm, which makes it a bit slower.
member.param: The first line to include in the chunk.
The last line to include in the chunk.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.Text.IsStartWordBoundary(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the Position in Text is is on a start-of-word-boundary, i.e. that the position is at the beginning of the string or that the prefix character is a non-word character. It assumes the position is already on a word character.
member.param: The a position in Text pointing at a word character.

member.name: M:UI.SyntaxBox.Text.IsEndWordBoundary(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the Position in Text is is on a start-of-word-boundary, i.e. that the position is at the end of the string or that the postfix character is a non-word character. It assumes the position is already on a word character.
member.param: The a position in Text pointing at a word character.

member.summary: Represents a line of text.

member.summary: The line number (0-based).

member.name: F:UI.SyntaxBox.TextLine.StartIndex
member.summary: The start index of the line relative to the entire text.

member.name: F:UI.SyntaxBox.TextLine.Text
member.summary: The text of the line.

member.name: P:UI.SyntaxBox.TextLine.EndIndex
member.summary: The end index of the line relative to the entire text.

member.summary: Initialises a new instance of the structure using the specified values.
